comments:
I200405280010

1. Occasionally, while editing text in the Java editor, the editor tab fails to
show the dirty flag. 
2. Save the file using Alt-f-s: the CVS change decorator does not appear in the
Package Explorer. 
3. Close and reopen the editor. All unsaved changes in the editor are discarded
and no prompt is shown to the user.


Observation:

At one point, I noticed that the dirty flag was not set, so I attempted to
select all and copy the contents of my editor before my changes got destroyed.

However, when I pasted the file into Notepad, all my changes were missing. What
I had copied was the version of the file on disk -- not the version of the file
I had been editing.

This happens to me frequently when Eclipse is under heavy load (running builds,
running JUnit test suites, and comparing with CVS concurrently).

Created an attachment (id=11294)
Complete log file (includes other sessions)

I'm not positive which session this bug occurred in, so I'm attaching my
complete log file from the workspace in question.

I will also prune this down a bit and try to attach the most relevant bits of
the log.

These exceptions look like they might be be relevant:

Hmm... yes, this exception seems to be generated whenever I give a java editor
focus.

The IAE is a dup of bug 64345. This has been fixed in I200405281200.

The NPE is most likely unrelated. According to the time stamp in the log the 
two exceptions have a temporal distance of 6 minutes. As of the JIT, its 
difficult to say where the NPE really happens. Assuming that it fails when the 
editor has been closed, this would imply the an editor has been closed without 
having called its dispose method properly. A similar behavior has been 
reported in bug 62321.

Filed bug 64648 for the NPE.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64345 ***
